meanings.definition: Any of a large class of organic compounds with a characteristic molecular structure containing four rings of carbon atoms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained how a steroid is made up of special carbon rings.
meanings.sent2: Athletes sometimes misuse steroids to enhance their performance.
meanings.sent3: The steroid molecule threw a party for the other molecules in the cell.
meanings.sent4: Her influence in the office was like a steroid, boosting morale and productivity.
meanings.sent5: In the world of molecules, the steroid stood out with its unique carbon ring structure.

meanings.definition: A synthetic derivative of this class of compounds, used in medicine to treat inflammation and regulate the immune system.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a steroid to reduce the swelling in my knee.
meanings.sent2: Steroids can have powerful effects on the body's immune response.
meanings.sent3: The steroid in the medicine fought off the inflammation like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like a steroid, giving her the strength to face any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The steroid medication worked like magic, calming the immune system's overreaction.
